Part of Semper-KI software

Silvio Weging 2025

Contains: File upload handling logics

Functions¶

logicForUploadFiles(request, validatedInput, functionName)

Logics for uploading files

getFileViaPath(→ None | io.BytesIO)

Get file from storage and return it as accessible object - you have to decrypt it if necessary

getFilesInfoFromProcess(→ tuple[object, bool])

Obtain file(s) information from a process

getFileObject(→ tuple[object, bool, bool])

Get file from storage and return it as accessible object - you have to decrypt it if necessary

getFileReadableStream(...)

Get file from storage and return it as readable object where the content can be read in desired chunks

moveFileToRemote(→ bool)

Move a file from local to remote storage with on the fly encryption not managing other information

Logics for downloading files as a zip file

Logics for downloading the history of a process

code_SemperKI.logics.filesLogics.logicForUploadFiles(request, validatedInput: dict, functionName: str)¶

Logics for uploading files

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest

  • validatedInput (dict) – The input

  • functionName (str) – name of the handler

Returns:

Nothing or Exception

Return type:

None|Exception, int

code_SemperKI.logics.filesLogics.getFileViaPath(filePath, remote: bool, decrypt: bool = True) → None | io.BytesIO¶

Get file from storage and return it as accessible object - you have to decrypt it if necessary

Parameters:

  • filePath (str) – path of the file

  • remote (bool) – if the file is remote

Returns:

fileObject from S3

Return type:

object

code_SemperKI.logics.filesLogics.getFilesInfoFromProcess(session, projectID: str, processID: str, fileID: str = '') → tuple[object, bool]¶

Obtain file(s) information from a process

Parameters:

  • session (dict-like object) – Session of the user

  • projectID (str) – Project ID

  • processID (Str) – process ID

  • fileID (Str) – file ID, if given then only that file is returned, else all files

Returns:

file metadata or Error HttpResponse , retrieval success

Return type:

(dict|HttpResponse, bool)

code_SemperKI.logics.filesLogics.getFileObject(session, projectID: str, processID: str, fileID: str) → tuple[object, bool, bool]¶

Get file from storage and return it as accessible object - you have to decrypt it if necessary

Parameters:

  • session (dict-like object) – Session of the user

  • projectID (str) – Project ID

  • processID (Str) – process ID

  • fileID (Str) – file ID

Returns:

(fileObject from S3, retrieval success, is remote location)

Return type:

(object, bool, bool)

code_SemperKI.logics.filesLogics.getFileReadableStream(session, projectID, processID, fileID, fromRepository: bool = False) → tuple[Generic_Backend.code_General.utilities.crypto.EncryptionAdapter, bool]¶

Get file from storage and return it as readable object where the content can be read in desired chunks (will be decrypted if necessary)

Parameters:

  • session (dict-like object) – Session of the user

  • projectID (str) – Project ID

  • processID (Str) – process ID

  • fileID (Str) – file ID

Returns:

Saved content

Return type:

EncryptionAdapter

code_SemperKI.logics.filesLogics.moveFileToRemote(fileKeyLocal, fileKeyRemote, deleteLocal=True, printDebugInfo=False) → bool¶

Move a file from local to remote storage with on the fly encryption not managing other information

Parameters:

  • fileKeyLocal (Str) – The key with which to retrieve the file again later

  • fileKeyRemote (Str) – The key with which to retrieve the file again later

  • delteLocal (bool) – If set to True the local file will be deleted after the transfer

Returns:

Success or error

Return type:

Bool or Error
